intro: Tricalysia obstetrix, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its velvety, waxy leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, often with a compact, bushy habit. Its flowers are usually pink or purple and are borne in clusters at the ends of the stems. Tricalysia obstetrix is prized for its ornamental value and is widely cultivated as a houseplant.
